review: Quite handy. Made more useful as third-party developments target the non-cable (television) on-demand consumer. HBO's trial of their "Now" (no cable television service needed for on-demand viewing) coupled with Plex (workhorse of a media streaming management multiplexer) for those with oh-too-many old television series (Hey, Dude and its missing episode 43 spring to mind, and Might Max, of course) attached to networked data drives, clinched the Fire TV Stick's purchase with a base level of usefulness for me.
